author: mininny
content: Hi Prysm team, we're running the new devent-6 specs and spamming the network with blobs. while testing, we noticed that prysm nodes had considerably larger number of `data column sidecar processing failures`(total - successes). Would there be any reason why this is happening? [Grafana](http://94.130.19.237:3000/d/dsfasdfasf/network-monitor?orgId=1&from=2025-04-14T23:25:32.013Z&to=2025-04-15T04:59:22.462Z&timezone=browser&var-network=peerdas-devnet-ssl-15&var-consensus=$__all&var-execution=$__all&var-group_by=consensus_client&refresh=1m&viewPanel=panel-65)

author: mininny
content:
Following up on the PeerDAS EL metrics, i'd appreciate any feedback on the [full proposal here](https://testinprod.notion.site/Proposal-for-Unified-EL-metrics-for-PeerDAS-1d28fc57f54680f2a3cbfe408d7db4b8)
- It would be great to have execution-metrics repo like [beacon-metrics](https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-metrics/pull/14) to track metric updates
- Regarding `metric name mappings` vs `actually same metric names`, one tradeoff I see is flexibility of implementation vs being able to utilize single metric for all clients in a single query, which helps with monitoring & analysis 
- As mentioned in the call, since we are creating new metrics for PeerDAS, there is more flexibility in adding new naming that might be unaligned with existing metrics - but also it doesn't require breaking changes like existing metrics does 
- For metrics to collect, I've added new metrics that nethermind is collecting for actual getBlobs hit/miss - since many clients already have these metrics, it could be matter of renaming the metrics to standardize them.

author: mininny
content: The change for geth was merged in, so i think it'd be good to roll out latest geth commit to devnet-6 to have things run with getBlobs as well.
